responses: It is the universal social security scheme for all Indians who are non income taxpayers
It is the national social security programme for all non-taxpaying Indians.
Atal Pension Yojana is a pension scheme that focuses on helping the working poor have a steady income after retirement.
The Atal Pension Yojana is a pension system that aims to provide a consistent income after retirement to the working poor.

patterns: Give me details of atal pension yojana
What do I get?
How much money do I receive?
How does it help me?
responses: Under the APY, guaranteed minimum pension of Rs. 1,000/- or 2,000/- or 3,000/- or 4,000 or 5,000 per month will be given at the age of 60 years depending on the contributions by you, the subscriber.
At the age of 60, you, the subscriber, will get a guaranteed minimum pension of Rs. 1,000, Rs. 2,000, Rs. 3,000, Rs. 4,000, or Rs. 5,000 per month based on your contributions.
Under Atal Pension Yojana, the Government will co-contribute in your retirement plan

patterns: What are the contributions in APY?
Contributions in Atal Pension Yojana
responses: You will need to co-contribute alongside the Government in your retirement plan. You will need to set aside a certain amount of money i.e contribution to be deposited in your account and the government will deposit about 50% of that in your account as well monthly
